over priced for not that great of food and small proportions- the setting is nice but the service is sub par; I wouldn't go to again
Not the quality I remember from Los Angeles, but times have changed. Better to stay local and find a good slice along the way.

I wish I could give half a star. The pizza was delicious, however they need to clean their beer taps and they made my friends drink way too strong, it was undrinkable. And the service from Shy was some of the worst I've ever had. We barely saw her, she never checked on us, another table near us went Ungreeted for well over five minutes. All around a really disappointing experience.

Ordered a full size salad and pasta through Door Dash. Took over 90 min and deliver person said they had to wait over an hour for them to make the food.  The salad was a small portion for full size ($15), the avocados were brown, and it was covered in blue cheese which I hate and wasn't described as an ingredient on the menu that I downloaded from CPKs website. Pasta was poor quality and a small portion. For $32 worth of food, extremely disappointing and will never eat from any CPK again

The Buffalo Cauliflower is literally AMAZING! And the wait  staff is exceptional. Best service I've received in a while. I wish I remembered my waitresses name so that I could give her a shout out! I'll definitely be back!

The food is always good but the service is sooooooo slow. This is why I ordered ahead. Gave them an hour before pick up. After 45 minutes still waiting for my preordered pizza. First it took the take out lady 5 mins to even acknowledge me and then she never came back to say, we didn't forget about it you u, still waiting or something! Will never. One to this location again. This is really ridiculous. Still here. They didn't offer water, pop or anything. Just told me 5 more minutes but my egg rolls been done so they will be super cold when I get home. SMH.
Love the Jeremy Chicken pizza. Nice drinks. Orchard Sangria bomb! I'll definitely come back. Oh, forget to order the Brussels Sprout & Bacon Flatbread.. to die for!!

My mother and I came for our one hour lunch. We work close by and got   12:15pm. At 12:35 we got water and another 10 minutes later we got a small roll of bread. We had to get back to work and still no food. The waiter said the side salada and small lunch pizza wasn't even startes yet. I told him thats a bit rodiculous thay the small salads were not even ready. He said "well people have been waiting longer than you and are just now getting their food. So you can talk to the manager". Absolutely rude. The manager advises that thet have a large order for catering. All i heard was excuses. The 1800 customer service line is just a voicemail and no one answers. Done with this place and its immature customer service/complaint department.
Great Veggie options here. Yummy veggie grilled salad, tasty greek pizza, kung pao pasta & barley & pea soup

What a horrible experience. Our waitress took our drink order and then about 10 minutes later she took our food order. We didn't get our drinks until AFTER our food served and that was only because we asked a different waitress for our drinks. We then asked for a side of ranch.. the waitress came back after about 10 min and asked what we wanted! Completely ridiculous. The manager did take our drinks off of the bill but after complaining, the original waitress did not apologize or anything. In fact, she dropped/picked up our bill without saying a word. Will never be back to this location.

Worst CPK experience ever. I personally love California Pizza Kitchen but this location consistently has the absolute worst service. We went today for lunch around 3pm (so not busy at all) and ordered drinks and two appetizers. Once our drinks arrived we ordered our food since we could tell it would take a while. 50 minutes later, we had not received anything, after asking for another drink and inquiring about our food. We talked to the manager and said she wouldn't address the issue with us so we left. Rude, slow staff. Extremely disappointed and will not be coming back to this location again.

I have been a loyal CPK customer. We sat in an empty place and waited over an hour for food. When asked the server said just an issue with the kitchen.. the food came out piece meal.. we could have shown up in 2 separate cars since we didn't even eat together . No apologies no help. The servers joking around not getting anything done. Worst experience at an cpk. Whoever the manager is should be retrained since the service is part of the experience .

I'm not sure if I was at the same California Pizza Kitchen as all these other reviewers. The service was incredible and the food was even better!! My server's name was Estefania and she was very attentive and stayed on top of our drinks and everything. She was very sweet. I got the California Cobb and my boyfriend got the Pepperoni Pizza and we both loved our food! The best CPK salad I've ever had! If you're thinking about not eating here because of the bad reviews, eat here anyway. It's the best CPK I've been to.

They are very disorganized at this location.  I placed an order 50 minutes ago for curbside pickup and am still waiting for my order.  I had to call twice to tell them I was here waiting, and was told the second time that they were JUST told I was here.  This was 20minutes after my initial call when I arrived.  I don't know why they never seem to anticipate the volume they have here; whenever I have actually dined in, it took well over 10 minutes for a server to greet the table.  All the restaurants in this area are busy, so this traffic is not new to them.  I am always surprised by how ill-prepared they are.

First Time For years I have purchased CPK from the grocery store and I loved it. So when I saw the restaurant I was excited to try the pizza from the restaurant. However they didn't have it. They did offer to make a version of the pizza. Instead I ordered hummus as an appetizer and garlic fettuccine with shrimp and mushrooms. Food The hummus was amazing. Nothing else to say about it. The fettuccine was awful. The pasta was under cooked and they were very stingy with the shrimp. Service I asked the hostess how long it takes to prepare the pizza, she said I don't know(in such away). When leaving the restaurant I asked another hostess the name of my server. She said I don't know who? With that, my server Brad or Blake(young guy) was great, helpful and patient.  The bathroom was disgusting. Out of respect I will not go into detail. Dirty bathrooms makes me think the kitchen is dirty too. Even through I appreciate my servers service I would never go to CPK again. I will stick to the grocery store pizzas.

Had an awesome visit to CPK tonight, my first time at this location and it did not disappoint. The staff was super welcoming and big shout out to Hector at the bar who helped accommodate my vegan diet by talking with me about my specific needs and going out of his way to make sure I had some great options to choose from. The service was so prompt and friendly, my guest and I truly felt at home. There was a good selection of wine and house cocktails, and our drinks looked great and tasted better. The management staff was always present interacting with guests and teammates to make sure things were running smoothly and I appreciated seeing that they really cared about what was going on in the restaurant. Chris and Miguel absolutely slayed it in the kitchen and made the best pizzas my friend and I have had in a long time (I can't believe it was vegan and tasted that good), cooked perfectly and beautiful presentation. It was very cool to get to watch them do their thing - since the restaurant features an open kitchen you get to check out all the behind the scenes stuff and really get a feel for everything that goes in to making your food come out perfect. Since the bar where we were sitting is right in front of the kitchen we got to chat with them throughout the process which was fun. I was very impressed with my visit and can't wait to return, thanks everyone for a great experience!

Poor service.  Slow.  Soup came out before waters.  Sons mac and cheese had hair in it.  When we ask for napkins the server said "you'll are asking too much."  Who says that!?!?!  Definitely not going to this location again!!

Okay as you all know I've went to the one in Dunwoody for my final time . Because it's still a favorite of mine I went to north point 10/20/17. It was great! Went with 3 friends. We ordered the bbq Pizza (their signature pizza), the sausage and mushroom pizza, strawberry lime margarita, and some of their fresh coolers. The drinks are usually about 10.00  My other friend tried the jambalaya which she thought was good. I love love love the butter cake. It's my favorite. The staff was very attentive. Not Sure if they were switching shifts because we had a different waiter/waitress. None the less, it was perfect. Food was bomb! Lots of laughter and fun.

Total great experience! Food absolutely on point. Nice clean restaurant. Have been to many CPK's all over the country and this was definitely one of the best.  I have to say what made it extra nice was the service. Our server KK was so engaging and fun. Perfect experience.

I had the lunch special. California veggie with a Caesar salad. Wasn't horrible, just wasn't anything that would make me want to get it again. I still can't get over how slow they were and It was a Tuesday.
I truly enjoy pizza but did not have a good experience. I felt it was overpriced and not the quality that I had hoped for. We hadn't eaten at one of these in over 10 years. I remember why now.

CPK is a chain, but their quality is consistent. From the Sangria to Veggie pizza, I was having a good time. This location is right off of Northpoint mall. You can't go wrong going here before or after shopping.

I came here the other day with a friend and ordered the orginial bbq chicken pizza that comes with; bbq sauce, smoked gouda, red onions and fresh cilantro. After waiting quite a while for our pizza to arrive, it came out burnt and tasted just like a pizza hut/papa john's pizza. Therefore, I was really disappointed and our waiter was not attentive enough.
Great pizza - service can be really slow, especially during the work week evenings.  However, the Margherita pizza has me coming back!  Brick oven baked and great for calorie counters :)

We had not been to CPK in a long time. I think that we had been raptured by Crust. So we came here to celebrate our 300th monthaversary (25 years) together. Still on our 3rd date!  We were offered seating on the patio and being such a perfect night - we did. Our server was an incredible young lady - Naomi. What a lovely lady with a great attitude and spirit. Best service we have had in a long time. Thanks Naomi! After devouring a fresh Ceasar salad and a petite wedge salad with applewood smoked bacon we greeted our entrees. I savored the Chicken Jalapeño Fettuccine with extra garlic and red chili flakes. It was a scrumptious blend of flavors. My lovely wife ordered a Margharite pizza. Thin crunchy crust with big basil flavor.  The hefty portions means yummy leftovers for tomorrow. We thoroughly enjoyed the CPK dining experience. Nice ambience on the patio, exceptional service by Naomi and filling, flavorful food. Home run CPK.

CPK is a national chain with a variety of options from pizza to pasta to salads. It's a simple menu for the most part and the service is always friendly.  My favorite pizzas are the BBQ Chicken and The Works. The price-point ranges from $10-15 for the pizzas which serve a hungry one or a health-conscious two :)  Don't forget to try their cocktails as this location makes them strong and almost worth the $8-11 price tag.  They have a customer loyalty program called Pizza Dough for those who love freebies.

I had been wanting to eat the food of California Pizza Kitchen for so long. The thought of tasting a gourmet pizza of this type that is not like fast food pizza whether Cici's Pizza or Papa John's or Little Caesar's.  In addition, I was a little excited to be around a more upscale atmosphere that I don't know, I just got the feeling the place exuded when I would pass it by. Was I right! I made my way there as a second option I was wanting to try out when Dave & Buster's loud and inattentive service failed to impress me.  Still good for me because I wanted so badly to try one of their gourmet pizzas and eat either some cheesecake or red velvet cake which I researched they served.  I'm a quiet person and like to keep to myself so preferably I want a restaurant that is quiet & low-key. Especially as I am simply there for the food. And I want to savor every morsel. Slowly too, just so that I can taste it fully. And as a matter of fact I can't understand people who go to restaurants with big parties since if you are socializing, how are you enjoying your food? I would never do it since if I'm going to restaurant it is for the food and nothing else. Not even to talk or chat with the waiters.  Anyway. I was tremendously glad when I arrived at around 8:45 PM give or take, that the atmosphere of the place was quiet and was pretty elegant looking. Even the outside with soft yellow lighting which contrasted wonderfully with the building. Right off: impressed. Next since I have never dined at a casual dining restaurant of the scale of California Pizza Kitchen I was a little worried to how I will approach someone about getting seated. It was not hard at all. I got seated (I mentioned yes I was dining by myself) and was told Breanna would be my server although I was assisted by her assistant, Kate.  And Kate was really nice and did a terrific job though she said she was still relatively new as a server. I thought she was very attentive and nice. Especially as she left me to my own devices to enjoy my food and would still come assist me when I needed to ask something.  But let's get on to it. What was my response to California Pizza Kitchen's food at Alpharetta GA North Point Dr? It was delicious and just as I imagined. First off the Strawberry Mango Cooler I ordered was so refreshing and sour. Perfect! I love sour flavors. Next, the red velvet cake was incredibly soft, creamy, and moist. Definitely tasted better than store-bought. Oh, and before I forget the red velvet cake can be served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream at no extra charge. Wow! That's amazing! Finally, the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage pizza was very mushroomy. It was on the organic-tasting side even though I ended adding salt and black pepper to it since in my opinion it needed better seasoning. Don't get me wrong. It was good but it needed more zest. I'm a huge believer that seasonings and spices add more flavor to food.  In any case, I was truly impressed by the attentive service and delicious food including the pizza. I certainly recommend and, of course, I myself will be returning to the restaurant whenever my top favorite musician TK from Ling tosite sigure announces an upcoming music release. As a way to celebrate that he'll be releasing new music.

Ordered a take-out and scheduled to be picked-up at 6:00 PM. Reached around 6:05 and the order was ready and the transaction was quick and courteous. I had ordered 2 Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizzas and spicy cauliflower. The Cauliflower was good but not too impressed with the Pizzas. The topping was scanty at best. It was hard to find the chicken on the Pizza. The pizza was just warm when I reached home which was just about 15 minutes drive forcing me to believe that the pizzas were ready much before the scheduled pick-up time of 6:00 PM. $ 13.99 for a warm-cold pizza with minimum toppings is not a great deal in my mind!

We stopped here for a light lunch while shopping. Ordered the chicken dumplings as an appetizer and split the Thai salad. It was plenty for two! The experience was excellent with the exception of them forgetting the avocado on the salad. Christopher was our server and he was great! Was a nice change from all of the other restaurants on our rotation.
Quickly placed a to-go order online.  Showed up 15 min later when it was scheduled to be ready...and it was!  Both salad and pizza were good but 1 star off just due to high prices.

Oldie is Goldie. After almost 20 years, my wife and I decided to try this restaurant in North Point Mall in Alpharetta, GA. We ordered soups and three appys to share instead of traditional pizza, that is what they are known for. My wife ordered Dakota Pea and Barley soup. She enjoyed. I ordered a bowl of Southwest tortilla soup. Soup was good but not very spicy for my taste. It was warm but I like my soup real hot. The 3 appys we ordered were: Buffalo Cauliflower, Avacado egg roll and roasted peppers. Enjoyed all three. However, cauliflower dish was the best superb and tasty. Roasted peppers were not hot but had a kick. Avacado Egg Roll was a little tame. On the whole it was a great eating experience in a place we last visited some 20 years ago.

Loved the Jambalaya Fettuccine it's a big hit and just indescribable awesome, also ordered the charred shishito peppers not hot at all absolutely loved it.  However the guacamole dip and chips were a miss the quantity of the dip was so minuscule most of us just ate plain chips no dip.  On a happier note again ... must have is the Brussel bacon flatbread. And the wild mushroom strozzapreti was delicious  However the service sucked we were not offered or given bread and dip which is usually served and the server vanished even though we had asked for water came 20min later . Food great service of this specific server not good had him on 2 specific occasions and both the times he had forgotten something. First time my childs meal and this time bread and dip water

First time at this location. My friends and I decided to drop by since we went shopping at North Point Mall today and wanted to grab dinner afterwards. Food - 3 stars. I ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti. Not good, the spaghetti was kind of hard. And the sauce was a too sweet. I've ordered this at other locations before and it was way better. It's probably a hit or miss here like another reviewer said, but this visit was definitely a miss for me. Service - 3.5 stars. Nothing extraordinary, but not bad. There were no offers to refill our drinks though. Maybe because we only had water. *shrug Ambiance - 4 stars. Nice and spacious. Welcoming lighting. Probably won't come here again since I'm such a foodie. I expect no less than a 4 star for a restaurant to be on my repeat list.
Just fine if you have a gift card and can spend other people's money. Otherwise there's better options
Yasmine is the best manager ever, very professional and very attentive! She will treat you like family.
Had a fish taco . Mmmm not so good also ordered an old fashion water down. Service was good. Food left a lot to be desired.

I think I'm done with this location! DONE!  This is actually the second time that I've had a bad experience, but this time I'm not letting it go without updating my review. Got here today around noon for lunch and was promptly seated.  That is where all the good things come to an end.  It took about 15 mins for our waiter to even acknowledge that we were there.  I watched him train someone on the ordering system while we waited during our lunch time.  Perhaps that could have waited until the lunch rush was over!!!!  We got some water and some bread, then we waited for our lunch special pizzas/salads to show up.  Well, it was 12:58pm and no food or waiter to be found.  Hmmmmmm, he then comes around the corner with food for the table behind us.  When I inquire about our food he says, that they were waiting longer than me and our food wasn't ready yet.  I told him that we didn't have time to wait he huffed and walked off.  We decided to leave, but I hung around to speak with the manager.  I explained to her about the wait and she even stated that our food wasn't ready.  The reason why was that they were busy and had a catering order. Hmmmmm, aren't restaurants usually busy for lunch near North Point? And, catering orders should not impede on in-house service.  She said that I could wait and she would pack up my food to go. NO THANKS! Sounds like they weren't prepared and we got screwed.  So, CPK....it looks like we're not friends anymore.  You let us down and the only remedy offered was for me to scarf down cold pizza at my desk. No THANKS.  Don't go here during lunch!!!!  Try times when you have hours to wait for your food or when they don't have catering orders or when there are less than 10 people in the restaurant.
Yesterday was Veterans Day they at the North Point location treated a Veteran like he was a king for the day and went overboard. Thank you again  California pizza kitchen
CPK has a great Valentine's special right now, the food was great and our waitress was friendly and attentive!
Do NOT come here for gluten free pizza. The crust was not crispy, dense, flavorless, chewy, awful. Also, they failed to mention it was tiny, so don't expect to be full after.

I've always been a fan of CPK, I recently had two back to back dining experiences here after not going for a very long time (couple of years maybe).   It's still as good as I remember.  The jerk chicken pizza was great, I also like the white pizza. Good food and good service.

Grilled vegetable salad was an B+.  Rewards program could be simpler. Cobb salad is delicious. If you're into crazy pizza like avocados and pineapple on your pizza they have interesting pizza selections.   they also have just your traditional meat and cheese pizzas too.

The food was good but the five stars goes to the service. As much as a picky eater I am. The server (ally) was on point. She Dealed with my complicated order and came out just like I wanted. Keep up the good work and good job manager for training see you guys soon maybe Friday.

Three stars...I liked it, Wifey didn't...so we averaged them! Went here for pizza one night...I got the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza...my favorite topping for a pizza...and found it to be very good.  As CPK was the originator of this pizza, you would expect it to be one of their very best. Wifey got a pepperoni pizza and was very disappointed in it.  She just, basically, did not like it...which is unusual for her. Service was good, we sat at the bar...

With all of the unique eateries that Metro-ATL has to offer, it's not often that we partake of national chain restaurants.  However, neither the wife or I had ever tried California Pizza Kitchen before so we decided to give them a shot (there weren't too many other restaurants near the North Point Mall that really drew our interest).   The service was pretty good - friendly, unobtrusive, yet present when needed.  The restaurant appeared to be kept clean.  The menu, though specializing in pizzas (with a unique flair) also was filled with flatbreads, salads, pastas, soups, sandwiches, tacos, various assorted appetizers, and other specialties - just about everything but the kitchen sink.  Usually, a menu this unfocused makes me nervous (restaurants like the Cheesecake Factory, or TGI Fridays have adopted this same approach - and as a result have produced mediocre food at best).   Fortunately enough, CPK did slightly better than the aforementioned restaurants.  The Avocado Club Egg Rolls come highly recommended - truly, I would come back for these alone (In fact, we did).  The supplied "ranchito sauce" was awesome spooned over those egg rolls filled with bacon, avocado, chicken, and Monterey jack cheese.  So good!  The Bianco Flatbread was ok, but forgettable next to the Avocado Club Egg Rolls.  So was the Crispy Mac 'N Cheese (I could do far better making these at home).  Don't get me wrong, none of this was *bad*, just forgettable. The Habanero Carnitas pizza was ok.  It was a bit too laden with red onion and cilantro for my taste, and the habanero salsa (paired on the side) was far to liquidy and sloppy to properly enjoy on the pizza.  Nevertheless, the pizza crust was good and I admired the creativity. No doubt, there's something here for everyone (though the trick may be finding it).  It's a place with a few hits, but more misses.  One thing is for certain, many of the menu items are decidedly Californian - with Mexican and Asian influences and creative interpretations.

This is one if those back up places. I am not a chain eater - well def try not to be. But when traveling sometimes you get stuck.  And being veggie now - its not that bad at all - for what I get there. The special arugula salad is wonderful and the barley soup is always solid. And bam - I have a nice meal!!! I really think its decent for what it is.

Service was friendly & quick enough considering it was Sunday & there was a small crowd. Our server answered our questions & described the dishes we asked about pretty well. We ended up getting the white pepper guacamole for an appetizer & it was probably the best guacamole/avocado dish I've ever had, but sadly the enthusiasm ended there. The pizza was very bland & ordinary. Definitely not worth the price, but even if you factor out price, none of the pizzas are very good. But I'm giving this place 3 stars because service is fine & the other items on the menu seem to be ok.

If you like slow service and mediocre overpriced food, this is the place for you. The pizza had some peppery spice on it as well as being undercooked. We didn't get drink refills until we finally left our table seeking them. There's many better places to spend your time and money.

Ironically, neither of us had pizza on this visit.  My jambalaya pasta was quite spicy, but since I'm acclimated it wasn't a problem.  However, the server was slow on refills which was unpleasant.  It also became an issue after we paid the check, as I couldn't get a refill despite having some afterburn.  The shrimp in the dish were a bit "fishy" tasting, and while not overwhelming generous, at least were plump.  My wife enjoyed her salad and we both find this location a bit more picturesque than the other franchises due to their landscaping, so it was an enjoyable visit.

Glad they have the gluten free pizza back.  We will be going back more often now.  Very good CPK near North Point Mall (not in it but out front of the mall).  I've always had very good service and food comes out very quick.

California Pizza Kitchen is located near the North Point Mall Alpharetta. Much better alternative than the food court at the mall. Monday night is  pretty dead so we got our food fairly quickly . I like the way that they allow you to split a pizza. Will be back here again.

Staff is very helpful and polite. No complains there. The place is very kid friendly. Place is full of them maybe cause it right next to the mall. The portions are pretty small. There are better places than this one to get decent sized, tasty and affordable pizza. Italian food - pasta, salads etc - is just about OK.

The food is good and the waiters are really friendly, but staff in Alpharetta cannot seem to get their act together regarding taking a basic call ahead reservation.  Make a point of doing a call ahead, no record, gave time, etc spoke to a guy, no record.  Sat there, others get seated, have to remind them, oh yes table opened up.  Sitting by the kitchen.   The food is good but don't need to be aggrevated on a weekend night at a restaurant.  Our server was very pleasant and did apologize, no one at the desk did much at all.  Seem to just be overwhelmed and disorganized.

So, for whatever reason, I was never a fan of CPK...not until now anyways! One my friends introduced me to them and I am a fan. The kids' menu is great! My 3 year old loves their broccoli and grilled chicken and their other selections are great too! The service has been stellar every time I have visited. It's a easy and reasonably priced place to go with your family. I love their roasted veggie salad with shrimp!

Incredible service, incredible staff. My family and I ate dinner at the bar after leaving a different restaurant where the service was awful. Eating at CPK easily turned our bad evening into a delightful one. I highly recommend sitting at the bar and having the privilege of experiencing Leila. She is extremely attentive, caring, and will make you laugh your entire visit.

Wanted to eat some pasta for dinner after visiting the mall. Big disappointment, I should have gone to Cheesecake Factory instead. Ordered garlic Parmesan fettuccine with chicken, spaghetti  Bolognese, asparagus spinach spaghetti with salmon... All 3 dishes were bland, no seasoning, pasta was either overcooked or undercooked. The fettuccine was 2 different colors, some of the pasta had a dark stripe down the middle showing that it was undercooked. I will probably stay away from CPK for a while, big disappointment.

Paid $13.99 for a bowl of noodles with watered down sauce.  Ordered the Chicken Tequila Fettucini which was so bad I didn't eat it.  Literally had 7 small chunks of chicken (less than 1/4 cup) and sauce was so watery it wouldn't stick to the noodles.  Waiter never served bread/butter and I had to ask for water.  Geeze!  This use to be a favorite place of mine but not sure I'll be back.  That alot of money for a bowl of noodles and not even bread!

I've eaten here plenty of time and plenty of locations. I mean, who doesn't love CPK!? But I felt compelled to write a review after having a stellar experience!  My boyfriend and I needed to grab lunch fairly quick in order to have plenty of time to drive downtown to catch a flight. Katherine was our waitress and she was awesome!  She was so friendly and made our experience so pleasant!  She is what every waitress should be like; attentive, friendly and prompt. We told her we were in a hurry to catch a flight and she made sure to bring our check right away. She did her best to make our experience great and to speed the process along as best she could! And the food was great, as always!  SO, of course eat at CPK! The BBQ pizza is the best on the planet and if you're lucky enough to get Katherine, she will make your experience that much more enjoyable!

The food here has  alot of variety for pizza oriented towards your Basic American Person. Due to the lack of ability to order slices, you either have to split a pizza with someone, take half of it home for lunch later, or eat it all by yourself and get a major case of "The Itis". (I generally go option 2) I have had a 3.5 type experience every time I've been here.  Not too exciting, but no real complaints either.
My husband and I ate here today and ordered two salads.. He the Chinese chicken and I  the chopped with no meat and extra Garbanzo beans.. Excellent food and excellent service !!!
Just because you have expensive and fresh ingredients does not mean you can cook good food.  Our pizza was dripping grease. The only reason I gave it two stars is because the service was excellent.

Came here for New Years Day lunch with my girlfriend. I ordered the jerk pizza, it was really good but you really have to like spicy food. She ordered the bbq chicken salad, a CPK favorite, and loved it. Definitely recommend CPK.

I waited until I was finished eating the pizza before I wrote the review, because as others have stated "the service sucks"  I agree with that statement 100%. I figured i'm place my order on-line to avoid any hassles with the wait staff and take it back to the office to eat while I worked. With that plan what could go wrong?  Well they have curbside service which should make things a breeze. Pull up sign your credit card statement and you're on your way. Not in my case dear reader. I pull up and wait, and wait and wait some more. Finally I get out of the car and go in to pick up my pizza the waitress exclaims " blue car?,  I was just about to go out and bring you your food"  Nothing about sorry for your wait or anything. Now mind you they gave me a window in which to pick up my food & I even gave them another 5 minute cushion to ensure it would be ready there when I went by there. All in all the service sucked as I stated earlier now to the main event. I got the BBQ chicken with blackwood smoked bacon. Even cold the pizza was yummy and the blackwood bacon is becoming a favorite of mine now having had it on two dishes this week.  Don't get my star rating confused, I know I did a lot of complaining at the start of this but the 4 stars are due to:  1. the food,  2. the website = being able to order stuff online and have it waiting for you is an awesome thing 3. the interior of the restaurant, very nicely decorated for a chain place.   Now if I ever get the nerve up to deal with the wait staff i'll update my review of a sit down experience. Oh and I almost forgot, what's up with the giant bags they give you for take out items?  I'm sure an entire tree didn't have to die just so I could bring some pizza back to the office.

Solid 3 Stars. The hummus was a little watery but fresh and the tortilla soup had good flavor, but could have used some more crunchy strips, though our waiter never really came around to check on us. It seemed he perhaps had too many tables because we were 'processed' get in, sit down, order, food on table, check, get out type of situation. We didn't care to homestead, but I would have ordered another drink if it hadn't taken so long to get my first one. I know I know its a chain, but still service is service.

The food is good as always but the prices have increased to beyond reasonable. $13.00+ for lunch with tip and I had a half caesar salad with chicken and water to drink. The value is just not there anymore.  I won't be going back anytime soon.

I had not been here in a couple of years when Annie suggested that we meet for lunch the CPK. Not bad. Really! Not bad.  I had the meat combination pizza. It could of used more spice and the crust was pretty soggy in the center. But it was a busy pie with lots of meaty tastes with great cheese and sauce. Not bad for lunch. It aint Anitco but certainly  a respectable pie.   She had the Moroccan chicken salad which she usually orders at CPK. This time, she complained that it was "too wet with too many beets" I leave it to others to judge such things.  Although we were there during lunch and the place was packed, the service was great. I would do it again.
Love CPK... This location holds up just fine! Good atmosphere and always satisfying food.

I have been to a few California Pizza Kitchens and this one was really pretty good.  The initial greeting at our table was a little slow but after that the service was great.   Dustin was great and suggested a good salad for my cousin and she loved it.   I started out with the pea soup....which is hard to find!  Pea soup is not usually on many menus...Yummy but not very hot.  CPK received 3 stars because the soup wasn't very hot and the drink service started out slow.  I had the cob salad and it was good...but was missing the avocado...Disappointing.  I had high hopes but it fell a little short.

I just want to give a shout out to the Waldorf salad here at CPK. I also want to say goodbye to a fallen friend, the Portobello Mushroom Ravioli. I usually don't frequent chains too often, but I just love CPK. The chicken and avocado spring roll things are awesome and the lettuce wraps are awesome! My favorite pizza is the garlic chicken pizza. Yummy! Try their whole wheat crust. Not bad. Oh ya, the flavored lemonades are great! Try the kiwi.

Food flavor has gone down.  Service was slow to lacking, from not refilling our drinks to not taking away plates. Manager needs some training on serving skills, he brought dessert and waited for us to stack dirty plates to make space, seriously??!!!

Used to go here a lot when kids were young, and it was pretty damn good for what it was - a premium chain. went back after a couple years and I must say taste wise it has gone way down. It was packed and loud as usual on a Friday night. Also quite pricey -$13-15 for a personal pizza?? Interesting topping combos but still.... Would not go back.

I'm not a fan of chain restaurants, but this place is really good! Our server (I think his name was Jesse) is a f'ing rock star! He was friendly, attentive, polite, knowledgeable ... everything you want in a good waiter. The appetizer's here are the best ... sesame chicken dumplings, baja chicken spring rolls with guac, and don't get me started on the asparagus and arugula salad ...AWE ...SOME! I'm a sucker for a good salad. I must admit, I've had better pizza's elsewhere, but the service, combined with really good appetizer and a rock star waiter makes this place worth visiting again.

The highlight of the meal was being seated and handed our menus by our server Daryl at 11:45 AM. It all went downhill from there and that is sad because I was looking forward to eating here because it had been a couple of years since I have eaten at a CPK. Our server finally showed up to take our order about 20 minutes after being seated. This was a bad way to start given how business people are constrained for time during lunch. I run out of water after 30 minutes. My glass sits empty, parched for the next 40 minutes. I think it's fair to say that not one employee of CPK had the consideration to stop by the top during the first HOUR AND TEN minutes it took for the food to arrive since being seated. (excluding the actual order taking). When I say our food arrived I mean it in the broadest sense. Because while everyone else got their food, my Waldorf salad was busy wilting away in some nether region of the kitchen. Did the kitchen staff notice? Did the server notice? Did the server stop by the following 15 minutes to check on everyone's meal? NO NO NO. At this point I didn't even want my salad, but my co-workers flailed their arms around and grabbed the server's attention and he "promptly" (ha ha) brought out my now deflated salad.  At this point we've reached the hour and a half mark in to the journey.  Should I even bother describing the salad? The apples,grapes, walnuts and Gorgonzola were fine, but of course the salad greens were limp and wilted after sitting in the balsamic vinaigrette.  By the time were were presented with the bill, the lunch (excluding travel time) took 1 hour and 45 minutes. And it's not like we were the only people with a slow table. Nearly, everyone around us at other tables when we started were there when we left. My Bill (thank good I only had water) for the salad was $16.40 (which included the automatic gratuity if 18%) Evidently TIPS stands for TO INSURE PATHETIC SERVICE. I'm NEVER going there again. They got my last nickel they will ever see from me.  Why didn't I see the manager? If I was not in a group environment and IF I had another half hour to waste. I would have. Instead I will vent here.

The food is great. The service needs to be improved. I went back 09/27/08 to eat with my boyfriend and his mom, the food didn't dissapoint and our waitress Carmen was great. She was obviously taking care of a huge section on her own, but she did it with a smile. I even told her before we left that I hadn't been there in a while because the service was so bad the last two times, but she'd changed my mind. Yay for Carmen! One more star for her.

This is my favorite CPK location because its nestled in a an area with all my favorite shops in Alpharetta! How convenient is that??  I love CPK's salad esp the barbecue chicken! its cut into tiny pieces and just perfect! Ive tried to recreate it at home to no avail so i guess ill just have to come back :) I never usually get pizza's from here coz i personally dont think they are anything special so im perfectly happy ordering their salads. Me and my dad split a tiramisu for dessert and it was pretty disappointing. But all in all i love CPK, always a good lunch place.

The review is based on service, not the food. I've been eating at CPK since it opened in Atlanta and not once have eaten a bad meal. Tonight though for the second time thru their online ordering I ran into an issue with pickup. I've already complained once to the mgr about on time delivery and she was very kind and sent coupons for a couple meals about a year ago. The issue I have is that the problems are not corrected. I appreciate my free meal , but if nothing changes in the curbside pickup I will have to take my business elsewhere permanently. I went tonight to pick up my order that I placed 45 minutes earlier in the evening and set the time to pick up at 7:30. I get to the pick up curb and call in. They tell me it will be out when ready. Ok...it should be ready since I was right on time at 7:29 and the order was placed 45 minutes earlier. I sat for 10 minutes in my car and still no order. I got out of my car which is the entire reason for me to go to Curbside Pick up and enter the restaurant, headed straight to the pick up area where they were completing my order. I was very nice and the woman completing the order apologized saying the order was on the house ; however, after I got home I realized I had charged the order already when I placed the order online. So she must be laughing at me right now since I had already paid! Well I plan on disputing my charge on my credit card now because she told me it was free for my troubles. The point of this message is CPK I hope you read the reviews here because YOU ALL MUST FIX the problems at your pickup/curbside service and be on time. The restaurant was given 45 minutes to get its act together and then the other 10 minutes while I waited in my car which is absolutely inexcusable. I will try one more time and if it happens again then I'm done forever with CPK. Its obviously not well managed otherwise this would not keep occurring. Hire more people for that area ,hire people that are more organized. Whatever the issue it must be fixed. I cannot be the only customer facing this issue.

Love, love, love California Pizza Kitchen.  They are one of those restaurants that has been pretty overrated, but I think they might be almost worth the hype!  The different types of pizzas you can get make it worth going.  I like their honey wheat dough a lot, too. Averagely friendly waitstaff, fast service, and the food is delish.

Whole family went here for lunch, standard menu, decent service, good food. We were happy. Had a 5 minute wait due to the week end rush, but the experience was pleasant. Will definitely go back here again,

The usual good food, huge serving sizes, and good service.  BUT, don't ever try their curbside pick-up service, unless you plan on sitting there for sometime.   Apparently, they cannot see the cars from the inside and therefore, they never know when a curbside pick-up customer pulls up.  It seems someone should have thought of this before advertising curbside pick-up service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! So, in short, if you want CPK, avoid curbside and go inside.
Sorry to be so short with this review. My experience and food here have been just like the other 3 California Pizza Kitchens I've been to. Food is solid and so is the service.

This place is always consistent. I always order the same thing. I'm not too big on specialty pizzas bc whenever I try to venture out and order something different, it is not as good as my usual.  I love most of their salads and the margherita pizza.  My new favorite salad is the BBQ Chopped Chicken Salad. My friend got me hooked on it.  Other good salads are the Thai Crunch Salad, Waldorf Chicken Salad, and Chinese Chicken Salad. I think I like the salads more than the pizzas! I'm more of a "The Works Pizza" type person. Not some fru fru Pear and Gorgonzola Pizza type.

Just ate lunch there today and it was fantastic! Haven't been there in years but thought i'd try it out. Had a med. salad and my husband had a new mango chicken pizza. Both were great.....will def go back.

I think this place has really great selection. The only problem is that I keep ordering the same thing anyway! Every time I go, I get this "personal" size pizza (so named--i think-- because one person should never be seen in public eating this much) that has roasted pears, onions, and toasted hazelnuts and is topped with a bed of gorgonzola dressing-drenched arugula. Being so attached to this pizza is a predicament--the salad on top of the pizza makes it a little awkward to eat in front of people, but I can't take it home because it will be nasty and soggy, so I always have to finish it there. Alas and alack, but I obviously enjoy it anyway. Also, they do have a full bar and can whip you up a raspberry mojito, no questions asked. I personally, like to order the champagne split; it's festive and compliments the large quantities of cheese being served.

Dinner was tasty!  Field greens salad with gorgonzola was huge, even to share--the sweetened walnuts were the highlight for me.  My pizza was the shrimp scampi on the honey wheat crust, my wife had a thin crust margherita.  Both were great.  It came out to $43 before tip, which is maybe a little high compared to good deals we've gotten at other national chains lately (Mimi's, Chili's), but we brought enough home to have a meal tomorrow too, so I think it was still a pretty good value.  Service was nice, our food came out quickly, though our check didn't.  One other minor complaint was crumbs on my seat from the previous diners, but all things considered, that wasn't worth knocking CPK down a notch.  We enjoyed it and would go back to this one or any others, like our closest one on Ashford-Dunwoody.
